method: Spray a large saucepan with oil and heat over a medium heat. Add the ginger, garlic and chillies and stir-fry for 1 minute.  Add 1.7 litres/3 pints boiling water and bring to a simmer. Stir in the miso paste, lime juice and noodles and cook for 1 minute. Cover and set aside. Spray a large wok or frying pan with oil and stir-fry the chicken, mushrooms and sweetcorn for 2-3 minutes. Add the peas and cook for 2 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.  Transfer the soup to 4 bowls, spoon over the vegetables and chicken. Top with watercress and serve with soy sauce on the side.
ingredients: low-calorie cooking spray,  5cm/2in piece fresh root ginger, chopped,  3 garlic cloves, crushed,  pinch of crushed chillies,  3 tbsp miso paste,  2 tbsp lime juice,  200g/7oz fine egg noodles,  2 chicken breasts, 125g/4½oz each, thinly sliced,  125g/4½oz  shiitake mushrooms, sliced,  70g/2½oz baby sweetcorn, chopped,  200g/7oz sugar-snap peas, halved,  85g/3oz watercress, tough stems removed,  soy sauce, to serve
